page.title: 14Interview: a local residents
page.content: Mr. Cyril Williams interview continued. He did not get much in the toy line to play with. He had very little pocket money to spend, but what he got went a long way. In answer to the question "Are the schools different today?" he replied "Yes, very much different. Children today are very lucky and should make use of all their privileges. School would start at 9 o'clock. Ten minutes for lunch, and one hour for dinner. Finish at 3.45. Many children had to walk home many miles. There were no buses to take them to and fro. There would be two rest breaks in school during lessons."
